paper.title: Towards Personal Financial Sustainability Based on Human Capital Analysis in Korea
paper.abstract: Financial sustainability for individuals has become more important due to the increase in life expectancy. In personalized lifetime financial planning, human capital is critical for incorporating the life-cycle of individuals. This study focuses on human capital modeling based on features such as education level and working industry, and presents how difference in human capital can affect the optimal asset allocation. By analyzing the Korean labor and income panel survey data, fixed effects regression was performed to model human capital and a portfolio model that maximizes utility of total wealth is solved to optimize the lifetime financial plan. The empirical results show that individuals with human capital that are more correlated with stocks are advised to reduce allocation in stocks.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是构建基于人力资本特征的资产配置模型，并通过优化总财富效用来解决个人终身财务规划问题，这直接涉及投资组合管理的领域。论文并未涉及衍生品定价或金融风险管理的具体应用。
